metadata.Title: CVE-2017-1000044 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
gtk-vnc 0.4.2 and older doesn't check framebuffer boundaries correctly when updating framebuffer which may lead to memory corruption when rendering

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000044` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gtk-vnc-2.0 - 0.5.3-0ubuntu2.1
gvncviewer - 0.5.3-0ubuntu2.1
libgtk-vnc-1.0-0 - 0.5.3-0ubuntu2.1
libgtk-vnc-2.0-0 - 0.5.3-0ubuntu2.1
libgvnc-1.0-0 - 0.5.3-0ubuntu2.1
python-gtk-vnc - 0.5.3-0ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gtk-vnc package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.5.3-0ubuntu2.1').
